main event: Three oval-shaped objects, initially red-orange in color, were observed on ground radar at 8:30 AM. The objects moved across the radar scope at high speed for 5-10 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed on ground radar, indicating they were real physical objects and not just visual sightings.
The objects changed color from red-orange to white and back to red-orange.
The objects moved at high speed, up to 20 mph, and made maneuvers such as a 180-degree turn.
The sighting was reported by a civilian witness who was deemed to be fully reliable.
The report suggests the objects may have been a reflection from lights at an amusement park, but this was not conclusively determined.
location: Approximately 5 miles southwest of New Orleans Airport, Louisiana
witnesses: Civilian witness, a student who was deemed fully reliable
photographs: No photographs included in the report
